001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.conversion;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonToken;
006import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationContext;
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonDeserializer;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidFormatException;
009import org.bitcoinj.base.Address;
010import org.bitcoinj.base.AddressParser;
011import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
012import org.bitcoinj.base.exceptions.AddressFormatException;
013
014import java.io.IOException;
015
016/**
017 * Deserialize bitcoinj (family) addresses
018 */
019public class AddressDeserializer extends JsonDeserializer<Address> {
020    private final AddressParser addressParser;
021
022    /**
023     * Construct an address deserializer that will deserialize addresses for any of the default supported networks.
024     * See {@link Network} to understand what the supported networks are.
025     */
026    public AddressDeserializer() {
027        this(AddressParser.getDefault());
028    }
029
030    /**
031     * Construct an address deserializer that validates addresses for the specified {@link Network}.
032     * When deserializing addresses, addresses that are not from the specified network will cause a
033     * {@link InvalidFormatException} to be thrown during deserialization.
034     *
035     * @param network Network id to specify the only network we will deserialize addresses for.
036     */
037    public AddressDeserializer(Network network) {
038        this(AddressParser.getDefault(network));
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * Construct an address deserializer with a custom {@link AddressParser}
043     * @param addressParser parser to convert a string to an address
044     */
045    public AddressDeserializer(AddressParser addressParser) {
046        this.addressParser = addressParser;
047    }
048
049    @Override
050    public Address deserialize(JsonParser p, DeserializationContext ctxt) throws IOException, JsonProcessingException {
051        JsonToken token = p.getCurrentToken();
052        switch (token) {
053            case VALUE_STRING:
054                try {
055                    return addressParser.parseAddress(p.getValueAsString());
056                } catch (AddressFormatException e) {
057                    throw new InvalidFormatException(p, "Invalid Address: " + p.getValueAsString(), p.getValueAsString(), Address.class);
058                }
059            default:
060                return (Address) ctxt.handleUnexpectedToken(Address.class, p);
061        }
062    }
063}
